sections.general:
PATIENT ADVOCATE
Career Overview
Skilled medical assistant with the sound knowledge of technical support, medical duties and clerical skills. Excellent communication skills along with
very solid customer service knowledge.
Core Strengths
Active listening skills
Energetic work attitude
Strong organizational skills
Patient charting
Healthcare billing proficiency
Health insurance processing
Clinical training
Insurance eligibility verification
Medical Assisting specialist
Medical billing
Computerized charting specialist
High customer service standards
CPR/BLS certified
Conflict resolution proficiency
Medical coding capability
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite
Talent in obtaining/charting vital signs
Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint
Patient positioning understanding
Detail oriented
Qualified in specimen collection/processing
Planning/coordinating
Microsoft Office
Excellent quantitative skills
Spreadsheet development
Insurance processing
Accomplishments
Honor Roll recipient
OSHA Compliance Â
Properly disposed of daily biohazard waste in compliance with federal and local regulations.
Customer Interface Â
Greeted customers upon entrance and handled all cash and credit transactions.
Assisted customers over the phone regarding store operations, product, promotions and orders.
Clinical Skills Â
Monitored patient's respiration activity, blood pressure and blood glucose levels in response to medical administration.
